verses.sanskrit: अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवमृत्विजम् । होतारं रत्नधातमम् ॥
verses.translation: I praise Agni, the chosen Priest, God, minister of sacrifice, the hotar, lavishest of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निः पूर्वेभिर्ऋषिभिरीड्यो नूतनैरुत । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
verses.translation: Worthy is Agni to be praised by living as by ancient seers. He shall bring hitherward the Gods.
Through Agni man obtaineth wealth, yea, plenty waxing day by day, Most rich in heroes, glorious.

verses.sanskrit: ॐ भूर्भुवः स्वः । तत्सवितुर्वरेण्यं भर्गो देवस्य धीमहि । धियो यो नः प्रचोदयात् ॥
verses.translation: Om, Earth, Atmosphere, Heaven. We meditate on the adorable glory of the radiant Savitr (Sun God). May he inspire our intelligence.

chapters.title: Mandala 10, Hymn 90 - Purusha Sukta (Hymn of the Cosmic Being)

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रशीर्षा पुरुषः सहस्राक्षः सहस्रपात् । स भूमिं विश्वतो वृत्वात्यतिष्ठद्दशाङ्गुलम् ॥
verses.translation: The Purusha (Cosmic Being) has a thousand heads, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet. He pervades the earth on all sides and extends beyond it by ten fingers' breadth.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुष एवेदं सर्वं यद्भूतं यच्च भव्यम् । उतामृतत्वस्येशानो यदन्नेनातिरोहति ॥
verses.translation: This Purusha is all that yet hath been and all that is to be, the Lord of Immortality which waxes greater still by food.

chapters.title: Mandala 10, Hymn 129 - Nasadiya Sukta (Hymn of Creation)

verses.sanskrit: नासदासीन्नो सदासीत्तदानीं नासीद्रजो नो व्योमा परो यत् । किमावरीवः कुह कस्य शर्मन्नम्भः किमासीद्गहनं गभीरम् ॥
verses.translation: Then was not non-existent nor existent: there was no realm of air, no sky beyond it. What covered in, and where? and what gave shelter? Was water there, unfathomed depth of water?

verses.sanskrit: न मृत्युरासीदमृतं न तर्हि न रात्र्या अह्न आसीत्प्रकेतः । आनीदवातं स्वधया तदेकं तस्माद्धान्यन्न परः किञ्चनास ॥
verses.translation: Death was not then, nor was there aught immortal: no sign was there, the day's and night's divider. That One Thing, breathless, breathed by its own nature: apart from it was nothing whatsoever.

verses.sanskrit: अतो देवा अवन्तु नो यतो विष्णुर्विचक्रमे । पृथिव्याः सप्त धामभिः ॥
verses.translation: May the Gods be gracious to us, even from the place whence Vishnu strode through the seven regions of the earth.

verses.sanskrit: इदं विष्णुर्विचक्रमे त्रेधा नि दधे पदम् । समूळ्हमस्य पांसुरे ॥
verses.translation: Through all this world strode Vishnu; thrice his foot he planted, and the whole was gathered in his footstep's dust.

verses.sanskrit: तद्विष्णोः परमं पदं सदा पश्यन्ति सूरयः । दिवीव चक्षुराततम् ॥
verses.translation: The wise ever behold that supreme abode of Vishnu, like an eye fixed in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य नु वीर्याणि प्र वोचं यानि चकार प्रथमानि वज्री । अहन्नहिमन्वपस्ततर्द प्र वक्षणा अभिनत्पर्वतानाम् ॥
verses.translation: I will declare the mighty deeds of Indra, the first that he achieved, the Thunder-wielder. He slew the Dragon, then disclosed the waters, and cleft the channels of the mountain torrents.

verses.sanskrit: अहन्नहिं पर्वते शिश्रियाणं त्वष्टास्मै वज्रं स्वर्यं ततक्ष । वाश्रा इव धेनवः स्यन्दमाना अञ्जः समुद्रमव जग्मुरापः ॥
verses.translation: He slew the Dragon lying on the mountain: for him Tvashtar fashioned the roaring thunderbolt. Like lowing kine in rapid flow descending, the waters glided downward to the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: स्वादीयसी पवमानस्य ते रसो मदिरतमो अङ्गिरस्वत् । जीरदानो अभि शस्तिपावाञ्छ्रेयो जिगाति महिषो नृषाह्ये ॥
verses.translation: In sweetest and most gladdening stream, flow pure, O Soma, on thy way, pressed out for Indra to drink.
